==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|gmh|bire}}, {{m|gmh|bir}}, from {{der|de|goh|bira}}, {{m|goh|pira}}, from {{der|de|VL.|pira}}, reanalysis of the plural of {{der|de|la|pirum}}. Early Modern German {{m|de||birn}} is from the Middle High German plural and dative/genitive singular, whence a double plural {{m|de||birnen}} was formed. The contemporary {{m|de||Birne}} is a new backformation from this plural (or perhaps a merger of it with the older, still dialectal form {{m|de||bire}}). Thus, between Latin and modern German, the word was reformed on the basis of the plural three times. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈbɪrnə/|[ˈbɪrnə]|[ˈbɪʁnə]|[ˈbɪɐ̯nə]}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Birne.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-Birne.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Birnen|Birnchen}} # [[pear]] # [[lightbulb]] # {{lb|de|colloquial}} [[head]], [[bonce]], [[noggin]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de |Abrissbirne |Abbruchbirne |Butterbirne |birnenförmig |Erdbirne |Glühbirne |Leuchtbirne |Kochbirne |Saftbirne |Tafelbirne |Williamsbirne |Birnenkompott |Birnenmus |Birnensaft |Birnensorte |Birnenschnaps |Grundbirne }} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|bor=1|et|pirn}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:DWDS}} * {{R:Duden}} {{topics|de|Body parts|Pome fruits|Fruits|Light sources}}
